page.title: 12GATHERING WHELKS
page.content: Several stony beaches in this block are used by local Whelk Collectors particulary Balichladich and Culkein. Whelk collecting is very hard and cold work. Waiting for low tide you gather suitable sized whelks in a bucket. A good whelk might weigh about 2 grams. You then transfer them into sacks of about 50kg. in weight. These porous sacks are then placed in water to keep the whelks alive. About once a fortnight the whelk buyer comes up and may offer the collector Â£12- Â£22 per sack depending on the season and the quality of the whelks. However this season the demand must have been great as some travelling whelk collectors came into this area and cleaned out the beaches leaving little shellfish left for the local collectors.
